definition: variant of 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
to watch from a height or distance/to survey
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield

sentences.english: I knew the inner workings of hospitals better than I understood the goings on in my own home.
sentences.chinese: 我對醫院的內部運作比我對自己家的狀況更瞭如指掌。

sentences.english: I'm very familiar with all the well-known characters from Jin Yong's novels.
sentences.chinese: 金庸小說中著名的角色我全瞭如指掌。

sentences.english: I know every inch of Toad Hall, inside and out.
sentences.chinese: 蟾宮的裏裏外外，每一寸地方，我都瞭如指掌。

sentences.english: The technical co-founder of SNS understands cloud computing from inside out.
sentences.chinese: SNS的技術創始人對雲計算可謂瞭如指掌。

sentences.english: But don't act as if you know everything about the place.
sentences.chinese: 但是不要表現出你對這個公司的一切都瞭如指掌。

sentences.english: Are the secrets of nature all mastered?
sentences.chinese: 難道大自然的奧祕都已瞭如指掌？

sentences.english: Maybe people aren't well informed about the Russia-China strategic ties.
sentences.chinese: 也許人們對中俄戰略關係並不瞭如指掌。

sentences.english: She has this university at her fingertips.
sentences.chinese: 她對這所大學瞭如指掌。

sentences.english: He knows the terrain of this locality like the back of his hand.
sentences.chinese: 他對這一帶的地形瞭如指掌。

sentences.english: Robert knows his business very well and has all the facts at his fingertips.
sentences.chinese: 羅伯特精通業務，並對所有情況瞭如指掌。

sentences.english: He was just nine years old but Tim knew a thing or two about building things.
sentences.chinese: 他才九歲，但是，對做東西，提姆是瞭如指掌。

sentences.english: “He seems to know the area pretty well.”“Oh.
sentences.chinese: 他看來對那個地區瞭如指掌。

sentences.english: Can you know everything going on in your field or industry?
sentences.chinese: 你對你的行業裏的任何事情都瞭如指掌嗎？

sentences.english: But do we know really know ourselves?
sentences.chinese: 我們真的對自己瞭如指掌嗎？

sentences.english: He knows the ins and outs of this organization like a book.
sentences.chinese: 他對這個機構的底細瞭如指掌。

definition: Milton (name)/John Milton (1608-1674), English republican writer and poet, author of Paradise Lost
see 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
Dole (name)/Bob Dole (1923-), US Republican politician, Kansas senator 1969-1996
unheard of/an extremely rare and unprecedented event
inside information/the ins and outs of the matter/how things stand/what's up
